events.message: The claimant reported an auto accident involving their sedan and a delivery truck at an intersection on April 30.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim has been categorized under Auto Accident due to vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to guide the customer through claim processing and support.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and informed the claimant.
The claimant was asked to provide photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and witness statements for further review.
All requested documents including police report and repair estimates were submitted by the claimant within the deadline.
The claims investigation team began inspecting the accident details and analyzing submitted evidence for liability and damage.
Investigation concluded determining the claimant was not at fault and the collision involved a delivery vehicle running a red light.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repairs and temporary rental car fees was proposed and communicated to the claimant.
The claimant provided positive feedback appreciating the prompt response and fair settlement offer for their auto accident.
Following claimant acceptance, the insurance company approved the claim and authorized processing for payment.
Payment for repair costs and rental car coverage was issued to the claimant's account, completing financial settlement.
The claim was formally closed after confirmation that all vehicle repairs were completed and payments satisfactorily settled.
The claim file was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference regarding the auto accident case.
